intro: Castela nicholsonii var. texana, commonly known as Texas castela, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Texas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of bright red tubular flowers, which are adapted for pollination by hummingbirds. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs. This species is well-suited to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats.
